books.author: Colleen Hoover

books.title: REGRETTING YOU

books.author: Callie Hart
books.description: Saeris is transported to a dangerous land of ice and snow, where she must contend with a Fae warrior who has suspect agendas. Read by Stella Bloom and Anthony Palmini. 20 hours, 42 minutes unabridged.
books.title: QUICKSILVER

books.author: Matt Dinniman
books.description: A Coast Guard vet named Carl and his ex-girlfriend’s cat, Princess Donut, are trapped in a fantasy dungeon. Read by Jeff Hays. 13 hours, 31 minutes unabridged.
books.title: DUNGEON CRAWLER CARL

books.author: Michael Connelly
books.description: The eighth book in the Lincoln Lawyer series. Mickey Haller enlists a journalist to help his lawsuit against an A.I. company. Read by Peter Giles. 10 hours, 50 minutes unabridged.
books.title: THE PROVING GROUND

books.author: Karin Slaughter
books.description: Officer Emmy Clifton investigates the disappearance of two teenage girls from a small town called North Falls. Read by Kathleen Early. 16 hours, 33 minutes unabridged.
books.title: WE ARE ALL GUILTY HERE

books.author: Fredrik Backman
books.description: A young woman looks into the story behind a painting that was made 25 years ago and a small group of teens depicted in it; translated by Neil Smith. Read by Marin Ireland. 13 hours, 7 minutes unabridged.
books.title: MY FRIENDS

books.author: Virginia Roberts Giuffre
books.description: The late activist and advocate for sex-trafficking survivors describes her time with Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell. Read by Thérèse Plummer and Gabra Zackman. 13 hours, 40 minutes unabridged.
books.title: NOBODY'S GIRL

books.author: Andrew Ross Sorkin
books.description: The New York Times journalist and CNBC host looks at the fight between Washington and Wall Street that fueled a historic crash of the stock market. Read by the author. 13 hours, 31 minutes unabridged.

books.author: Kamala Harris
books.description: The former vice president recounts her abbreviated campaign to become president in 2024. Read by the author. 9 hours, 58 minutes unabridged.
books.title: 107 DAYS

books.author: John Kennedy
books.description: The Republican senator from Louisiana shares stories about politics in Washington, D.C., and in his home state. Read by the author. 8 hours, 13 minutes unabridged.
books.title: HOW TO TEST NEGATIVE FOR STUPID

books.author: Eric Trump
books.description: The executive vice president of the Trump Organization shares his belief that attacks on his family are attacks on America. Read by the author. 8 hours, 19 minutes unabridged.
books.title: UNDER SIEGE

books.author: Matthew McConaughey
books.description: The actor and author of “Greenlights” explores elements of belief and reason that make up our lives. Read by the author. 2 hours, 12 minutes unabridged.
books.title: POEMS & PRAYERS

books.author: Jen Hatmaker
books.description: The host of the "For the Love" podcast describes major shifts in her life after her marriage of 26 years ended. Read by the author. 7 hours, 30 minutes unabridged.
books.title: AWAKE

books.author: Jonathan Haidt
books.description: A look at the mental health impacts that a phone-based life has on children. Read by Sean Pratt and the author. 10 hours, 33 minutes unabridged.
books.title: THE ANXIOUS GENERATION

books.author: Charlie Sheen
books.description: The actor, known for his roles in “Platoon” and “Two and a Half Men,” shares stories about his life in Hollywood. Read by the author. 8 hours, 58 minutes unabridged.
books.title: THE BOOK OF SHEEN

books.author: Peter Attia with Bill Gifford
books.contributor: by Peter Attia with Bill Gifford
books.description: A look at recent scientific research on aging and longevity. Read by Peter Attia. 17 hours, 8 minutes unabridged.
books.title: OUTLIVE

books.author: Bessel van der Kolk
books.description: How trauma affects the body and mind, and innovative treatments for recovery. Read by Sean Pratt. 16 hours, 17 minutes unabridged.
books.title: THE BODY KEEPS THE SCORE

books.author: Elizabeth Gilbert
books.description: The author of “Eat, Pray, Love” depicts her journey through a cycle involving self-destructive tendencies. Read by the author. 10 hours, 10 minutes unabridged.
books.title: ALL THE WAY TO THE RIVER

books.author: Matthew McConaughey
books.description: The Academy Award-winning actor shares snippets from the diaries he kept over 35 years. Read by the author. 6 hours, 42 minutes unabridged.
books.title: GREENLIGHTS

books.author: Michael Harriot
books.description: A columnist at TheGrio.com articulates moments in American history that center the perspectives and experiences of Black Americans. Read by the author. 15 hours, 42 minutes unabridged.
